profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:21-0400

did.unittitle: J. H. (John Hasbrouck) Van Vleck papers, 1923-1959
did.abstract: These contain a few notes and memoranda by Van Vleck, but the bulk of the collection is letters to and from him. Correspondents include Raymond T. Birge, Gerhard H. Dieke, Paul A. M. Dirac, Edwin C. Kemble, and Robert S. Mulliken.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Presented by J. H. Van Vleck and accessioned, 1964.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: This collection forms part of the Archives for the History of Quantum Physics, for which a complete listing appears in "Sources for the History of Quantum Physics," edited by Thomas S. Kuhn, et al. (Philadelphia, 1967).

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: J. H. Van Vleck was a physicist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D. 189 items. Various sizes. Presented to the Archive for the History of Quantum Physics by Van Vleck;1964.

did.unittitle: Summary, paragraph by paragraph, of Bohr's "Uber die Anwendung de Quanten-theorie auf den Atomban...";

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.D. 4p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics,No.2.)

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, Typed L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning his paper:The Quantum Theory of Line Spectra" with comments by Ruark. Suggestions for its publication in the Bulletin of the National Research Council.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, A.L.S. 1p.and enc.of pp.1-16,19-33. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Encloses his comments on the article: "The Quantum theory of Line Spectra." at the request to Foote.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 12p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) His work in physics for the year with Bohr and Kramers and his comments on them. Refers to Urey as a fellow student.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, Mass., Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Comments on his paper and work on the correspondence principle for absorption.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L.with 1p. in A.L. 3p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning dispersion formula and his work on the quantum theory of line spectra Needs comments of Bohr on Rydberg formula.

did.unittitle: Letter to Paul D. Foote, Washington, D.C.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No. 2.) Questions concerning footnotes of his bulletin on quantum physics.

did.unittitle: Letter to John H. Van Vleck

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. in German.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copenhagen, A.L.S. 3p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics.No.2.) Concerning the absorption and dispersion formulae. "Motion [in atoms"...can not be described by mechanics." Refers to work done by Slater, Einstein, Planck and Bohr.

did.unittitle: Letter to M[ax] Born, GÃ¶ttingen, Ger.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Their articles on dispersion and absorption formulae. Quantum physics.

did.unittitle: Letter to Paul D. Foote, Washington, D.C.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Sorry he is taking so long to get his paper ready for publication. Quantum theory.

did.unittitle: Letter to H[endrik] A[nthony] Kramers, Copenhagen, Den.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 4p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Agrees with him rather than with Becker on the correspondence principles for absorption and dispersion.

did.unittitle: Letter to E[dwin] C. Kemble, Cambridge, Mass.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning atomic theory. His work goes slowly.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, Mass., Typed L.S. 4p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No..2.) Concerning his paper on correspondence principles. His work on polarization of resonance radiation.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. VanVleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, Mass., Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Questions on inner quantum numbers. Physics. Refers to Slater.

did.unittitle: Letter to E[dwin] C. Kemble, Cambridge, Mass.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Comments on study on "the states of maximum inter quantum numbers should be those of minimum energy."

did.unittitle: Letter to John C. Slater, Cambridge, Mass.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Discusses his problem and has tried to include it in the Correspondence Principle of Dispersion. Will discuss it with him.

did.unittitle: Letter to Paul D. Foote, Washington, D.C.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Minneapolis, Minn., Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Questions for the publication of his paper and his just finished a section on the "dynamical technique of the quantum theory."

did.unittitle: Letter to John O. Slater, Cambridge, Mass.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning spatial quantization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Cal., A.L.S. 4p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Questions on molecular energy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Cal., A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Thanks for his help in developing his energy formula.

did.unittitle: Letter to Paul D. Foote, Washington, D.C.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Madison, Wisc., Typed L. 5p.and enc.of 7p. Carbon copy (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Forwards his manuscript: "Quantum Principles and Line-Spectra" and encloses some pages listing material which might be deleted. Comments on publication.

did.unittitle: Letter to G[erhard] H. Dieke, Berkeley, Cal.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 3p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Discusses questions in quantum physics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Typed L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning his paper on curves of specific molecules, calculated "on Einstein's suggestion."

did.unittitle: Letter to Max Born, Gottingen, Ger.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Incomplete. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Comments on his articles on excited molecules. Physics.

did.unittitle: Letter to G[erhard] H. Dieke, Berkeley, Cal.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning the study on curves and oscillations.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, Mass., Typed L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning specific heat of hydrogen. Projected work of Slater on "alternating intensities in band spectra of gas molecules...of two similar atoms."

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, D.C., L.on postal card. 1p.and add. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning his proof for his work on line spectra.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, Mess., Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Apologizes for errors in his text. Hopes to meet him to explain certain things about quantum physics.

did.unittitle: Letter to Max Born, Cambridge, Mass.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Hopes to invite him to lecture at Minnesota.

did.unittitle: Letter to Paul D. Foote, Washington, D.C.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning proof of his book. Would like to see such publications in hard bindings, even at additional cost.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, D.C., A.L.on postal card. 1p.and add. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Doesn't believe the important publications can be bound at this time.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, Mass., Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Can visit him in Chicago. Would like to lecture on the new quantum theory at Minneapolis.

did.unittitle: Letter to Max Born, Cambridge, Mass.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L.with ms.notes. 1p. Carbon copy (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning his lecture at Minnesota on quantum physics.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, Mass., Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Has already filled his schedule and cannot lecture on quantum theory at Minnesota. Hopes they can meet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, D.C., A.L.S. 2p. (see Archives for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning quantum theory as worked out by Born and Fermi.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Telegram. 1p. Carbon copy "Approximate Copy." (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning his publication on quantum physics.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Cal., Typed L.S. 1p (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Is to lecture on quantum theory at Madison, but would like to discuss things with him, personally.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Cal., Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Asks him to write on quantum theory for the Optical Society of America. Physics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Articles and work for committee on physical optics. Concerning work on quantum theory. Refers to Mulliken and Dieke.

did.unittitle: Letter to E[dwin] C. Kemble, Cambridge, Mass.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Congratulates him on his Guggenheim. Concerning publications on quantum theory. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Cal., A.L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning a study on quantum of the hydrogen.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Schenectady, N.Y., Typed L. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics.No.2.) Compliments him on his publication on quantum principles. Wishes it had been better bound and printed.

did.unittitle: Letter to E[dwin] C. Kimball [Kemble], Cambridge, Mass.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Hopes they can get cloth covers on his publication.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Cal., Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics.No.2.) Thanks for the publication, and explain why he sold it. Concerning work for the Physical Optics committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ludington, Mich., A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics.No.2.) Is glad he is publishing on quantum theory for he thinks the more published, the better. Concerning dielectrics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Cal., Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning reports for the Physical Optics committee on various studies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Chocorua, N.H., A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics.No.2.) Concerning his work on dielectrets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning his syllabus on the new quantum mechanics and comments on it.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning work on dielectric constants. Concerning atoms and molecular activity.

did.unittitle: Letter to the members of the Committee on Physical Optics, Optical Society of America;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cal., Typed L.S. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Reports on what is to be printed, including Van Vleck's article on quantum theory.

did.unittitle: Letter to the members of the Committee on Physical Optics, Optical Society of America;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Typed L.S. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Additional information on the forthcomin report on relativity, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, N.Y., A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No. 2.) Concerning his study of rigid rotations of molecules; encloses carbon copy. For enclosure,see: Kronig. The Dielectric Constant...; [Sept. 1926].

did.unittitle: Letter to R[aymond] T. Birge, Berkeley, Cal.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 3p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning their report for the Optical Society, with comments on bibliography for quantum theory.

did.unittitle: The dielectric constant of symmetrical polyatomic dipole-cases on the new quantum mechanics;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed D. 6p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Enclosed originally in: Kronig to Van Vleck; Sept. 24, 1926.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Cal., Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning a publication on quantum physics for the Optical Society.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Madison, Wisc., Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Congratulates him on his report on the new quantum theories.

did.unittitle: Letter to the members of the Physical Optics Committee;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Cal., Typed L.S. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for one History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning the publication on quantum physics.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, Mass., Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning studies on quantum physics and comments on them.

did.unittitle: Letter to E[dwin] C. Kemble, Cambridge, Mass.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Discusses various problems in quantum physics.

did.unittitle: Letter to [Sir] C[harles] G. Darwin, Edinburgh, Scotland;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning his work on lines.

did.unittitle: Letter to the members of the Physical Optics Committee;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archives for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Hopes their report will soon be out. Suggestions for proof-reading.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Orbana, Ill., Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archives for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Comments on studies on chemical constants.

did.unittitle: Letter to E[dwin] C. Kemble, Cambridge, Mass.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Suggests editorial changes for paper by Mulliken on quantum physics.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck;

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Rawlins, F. I. G. (Francis Ian Gregory), 1895-1969

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, England, A.L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Asks for his publications on quantum physics and encloses his own.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Madison, Wis.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, Mass., Typed L. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics.No.2.) Concerning publications on the new quantum mechanics.

did.unittitle: Letter to the members of the Physical Optics Committee;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Cal., L.S. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning the publication and distribution of the Physical Optics report.

did.unittitle: Letter to Arthur [Edward] Ruark, Pittsburg, Penna.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Comments on his paper on quantum postulates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Cal., Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning their publication and problems in getting it off the press. Refers to Kemble and his publication.

did.unittitle: Letter to Robert S. Mulliken, New York;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Hopes he moves to Minnesota. Gives some new results on NO and O2 in quantum theory

did.unittitle: Letter to Gregory Breit, Washington, D.C.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L.S. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Thanks for loan of slides. Comments on Dr. Schroedinger who visits Washington.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Utrecht, A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Recommends a young physicist, Niessen, for a post and comments on his work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Typed L.S. 2p. (See Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Several questions on line-spectra and quantum theory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, Typed L.S. 3p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Comments on work on No and O2. Quantum theory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Breslau, Ger., A.L.S. 2p. In German. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Thanks for publication on line-spectra of the hydrogen atom. Some of his own experiments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 3p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Comments on his paper. Asks him to read a paper on quantum physics for him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, Typed L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning line-spectra.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Edinburgh, A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Comments on, "The Electron as a Vector Wave" and theories on the atom.

did.unittitle: Letter to the Secretary for Research Council Fellowships in Physics...,National Research Council, Washington, D.C.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics.No.2.) Recommends Oppenheimer for a fellowship

did.unittitle: Letter to R[aymond] T. Birge, Berkeley, Cal.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning the normal state of NO, as Mulliken states. Publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Munich, Ger., A.L.S. 4p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) His work. Interest in NO and O2, and comments on them. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Cal., Typed L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Considering his and Mulliken's work on line-spectra. Concerning Dirac and comments on his anti-American statements. Refers to Condon.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Utrecht, A.L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Thanks for his letter on the lack of posts for Niessen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, A.L.S. 6p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics.No.2.) Disagrees with him on his paper regarding"the validity of the formula for the magnetic movement of atoms and molecules induced by a magnetic field," and explains Refers to Darwin.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Debye, Peter J. W. (Peter Josef William), 1884-

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Madison, A.L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics.No.2.) Thanks for his publication on physics and has already used the main features of it in a lecture.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L.S. 7p.and 3p.duplicated. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning the measurement of angular momentum measured with reference to fixed muclei. Refers to Debye.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning molecules and atoms as expressed in his last letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 4p. Incomplete. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) On quantum mechanics. Is"computing helium!!" Glad he will be at Palo Alto, California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Cal., Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Comments on publications on quantum theories with comments of certain men.

did.unittitle: Letter to Wheeler P. Davey, State College, Penna.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Incomplete. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Forwards article and makes comments on what can be omitted, etc.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Orbana, Ill., Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Asks a question based upon his paper on dielectric constant.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning his work on helium. Friendly letter.

did.unittitle: Letter to G. E. Stechert and Co., New York;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: L. 1p. Incomplete. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning the possibility of a reprint of his work on "Quantum Principles and Line Spectra."

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, D.C., Typed L.S.: Dayton C. Miller, by Nera E. Reynolds. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Will make 300 reprints of his "Quantum Principles and Line Spectra."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, Mass., A.L.S. 2p. (see Archives for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) His studies on atomic matter of oxygen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 3p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) States his "contraction of the doublets." Asks him to see if it conflicts with present work. Friendly letter.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, Mass., Typed L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Congratulates him on his formula for the "doublet contraction." His work on the subject is now worthless. Friendly letter.

did.unittitle: Telegram to [John H.] Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ann Arbor, Mich., D. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning an article which he believes "a half page addition to proof will correct" on computations.

did.unittitle: Letter to Paul D. Foote, Washington, D.C.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. Mutilated (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Since quantum theory progresses so rapidly, he has had to rewrite a large part of a chapter, even though in galley, which he returns.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning the formula for "narrow doublets" as worked out with Hill. Concerning Hill's future as a graduate student. Friendly letter.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Minneapolis, Minn.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, Mass., Typed L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning possible position for Hill. Quantum theory.

did.unittitle: Letter to Wheeler P. Davey, State College, Penna.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Forwards his manuscript and states that the quantum theory "is now getting in a more settled condition."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Utrecht, A.L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Plans to lecture in the U.S. and would like to visit Minnesota to lecture and talk with him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Theory. No.2.) Asks if certain work has been done in quantum physics and explains his need to know.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, A.L.S. 6p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics.No.2.) Concerning O-type doubling and related theory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, A.L.S. 4p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning "magnetic susceptibilities." Concerning a problem in quantum physics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, Mass., Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Congratulations on his Guggenheim. Concerning his book on quantum physics.
Not Found: 4/2011

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Theory. No.2.) Extends invitation for him to visit Minnesota. Comments on trip to the West Coast.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Toronto, Can., A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Hopes he can visit Minnesota and lecture.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. Incomplete for this is marked: [Page] 4. (see Arhive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning quantum theory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Toronto, A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Can visit and lecture at Minnesota and states dates and hours.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) States that his work may overlap Kronig's, but explains work of self and Hill. Quantum theory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Theory. No.2.) Asks if he could lecture so that appeal would be made to chemists as well as physicists.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, A.L.S.: Mully. 3p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics No. 2.) His work on O-type doubling. Comments and questions on O-type doubling.

did.unittitle: Letter to W[orth] H. Rodebush, Urbana, Ill.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Comments on the atom in the "S-state."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Forwards article and asks comments. Concerning "excited electron states."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Zurich, A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning O-doubling. Comments on his work in "fine structure terms".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Cal., A.L.S. 3p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning work on the theory of molecular structure and stays that Mulliken deserves credit for work listed as "Birge and Mulliken".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Cites a new publication and asks if he [Slater] wishes to change his current article on helium.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning O-type doubling.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 7p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Wants them to publish on O-type doubling together. Comments on various questions of quantum theory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L.S. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning work on electron spin and asks if he would like to publish together.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Zurich, A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Writes on his computations on the "perturbation matrix which give rise to the splitting [doublet splitting]."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ann Arbor, Mich., A.L.S. Mully. 4p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics No.2.) O-type doubling. Will revise his article. Comments on work of Birge.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning a paper by Hill and self "on the rotational distortion."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: ZÃ¼rich, A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning work on "the perturbations in bands and the predissociation of molecules" and the prospects of their publishing to gether.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Chicago, I11., A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning his work on helium. Kramers is to visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Incomplete. Carbon copy (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning the publication of his table of constants.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Chicago, A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics.No.2.) Will visit him, but not for football. Comments on a letter of Dirac. Refers to Bohr, physics, etc.

did.unittitle: Letter to P[aul] A. M. Dirac, Cambridge, Eng.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Glad he is to lecture at Minnesota and hopes the lecture will be on quantum physics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S.with initials. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning a program for talks on quantum physics and comments on the men and subjects.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Outlines his talk on quantum theory and comments on the rest of the program. Suggests Swann be invited to talk.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Utrecht, A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Hopes Van will visit. Concerning work on the oxygen molecule. Concerning Dirac and his new ideas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L.S.with initials. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning their talks and he wishes them to be on the "inherently statistical nature of quantum mechanics," at a meeting

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning reading in quantum theory.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Dirac, P. A. M. (Paul Adrien Maurice), 1902-1984

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, Eng., A.L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Will begin his lectures with the transformation theory and go from there. Students will need prior quantum theory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berkeley, Cal., Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning his tables of constants and the general constants for physical science

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Utrecht, A.L.S. 2P. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning his work on Oxygen and some problems of a student in physics.

did.unittitle: The vibrations of CO2 molecule, [to John H. Van Vleck;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: ca.]. A.D. 3p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.)

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Madison, Wisc.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ithica, New York, Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archives for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning a report on the symposium at the Franklin Institute on physics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Chicago, A.L.S.: Mully. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics No.2.) Asks for information from him or Hill about the Zeeman levels,etc.

did.unittitle: Letter to E[arle] H. Kennard, Ithaca, N.Y.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 3p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Replies to questions pertaining to quantum physics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics No.2.) Concerning his paper on various aspects of quantum theory and comments on it.

did.unittitle: Letter to H[endrik] A. Kramers,Utrecht, Holland;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Comments on "matrix elements with the type of binding force" in his oxygen paper Comments on work in quantum physics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 4p.and 1p.equations. Carbon copy. (see Archive for History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Lengthy comments on various questions on work in quantum physics as in certain papers which they are writing.

did.unittitle: Letter to R[aymond] T. Birge, Berkeley, Cal.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Thanks for his table on constants and comments on it.

did.unittitle: Letter to G[regory] Breit, Washington, D.C.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No. 2.) Comments on "doubling phenomena in molecular spectroscopy. Refers to Dirac's visit. His comments on Eddington's theory of fine structure constant,value 1/136.

did.unittitle: Letter to P[aul] A. M. Dirac, Cambridge, Eng.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning his lecture on quantum physics. Suggestions as to the means of travelling across the U.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S.: Mully. 3p. (See Archive for the History of Quantum Physics No.2.) Concerning their articles on quantum theory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning the Raman effect and hopes a book will appear on it.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, D.C., A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics.No.2.) Suggestions on a colloquia on atomic physics and Suggests Heisenberg, Dirac, Sommerfeld, Vallarta, with possible topics

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, Mass., A.L.S. 3p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics.No.2.) Concerning the Raman effect. Concerning Heisenberg's lectures and the "small mutiny" he has stirred up in physics.

did.unittitle: Letter to J[ohn] H. Van Vleck, Madison, Wisc.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Urbana, Ill., Typed L.S. 1p. (see Archive for History of Quantum Physics.No.2) Concerning the"chemical constant of hydrogen."

scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning the chemical constants of hydrogen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Travelled across the U.S.on train full of Shriners. Grand CaÃ±yon and Yosemite full of Shriners, but Yosemite empty of them now. Beautiful place.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pasadena Cal., A.L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics.No.2.) His apparatus for measuring the magnetic susceptibilities of gas proves Van Vleck's predictions on NO. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2) Forwards his letter to Bitter on measuring magnetic susceptibilities of gas. On same sheet as: Van Vleck to Bitter; June 26, 1929.

did.unittitle: Letter to Francis Bitter, Pasadena, Cal.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning his measurements of the magnetic susceptibilities of gas. Other work in the same field. On same sheet is: Van Vleck to G.G. Havens;June 26, 1929,on copy of above.

did.unittitle: Letter to W[orth] H. Rodebush, Urbana, Ill.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning Fowler and his work on the chemical constant of hydrogen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S.: Mully. 3p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Questions concerning an equation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [ca.]. A.L.S. 4p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics.No.2.) Describes Leipzig. Concerning his stay in Germany and Plans for trip home. Friendly letter.

did.unittitle: Plans for study in connection with an application for a Guggenheim fellowship;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed D. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Chicago, Typed L.S. 2p. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Questions concerning work on doublets, meaning of the "magnetic moment", energy levels in a magnetic field, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 2p. Carbon copy. (see Archive for the History of Quantum Physics. No.2.) Concerning a future publication by Condon and also possible translation by Brilliouin and wonders is he would like to publish them, since the Oxford Press does such beautiful mathematical printing.
